system

Class Job

  • java.lang.Object
    • system.Job
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class Job
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

    Job encapsulates the data structures & methods for a particular kind of graph problem, as well as parameter values for a particular instance of such a graph problem.

    The number of Workers is an attribute, not of Job, but of the cluster on which jpregel runs.

    Where a job is deployed (locally or on an external cloud) is an attribute, not of Job, but of the Client.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Job

        public Job(java.lang.String jobName,
   java.lang.String jobDirectoryName,
   VertexImpl vertexFactory,
   MasterGraphMaker masterGraphMaker,
   WorkerGraphMaker workerGraphMaker,
   MasterOutputMaker masterOutputMaker,
   WorkerOutputMaker workerOutputMaker)
        Parameters:
        jobName - The name used by jpregel when producing job run information.
        jobDirectoryName - The relative path to the job directory. If it is a local execution, the path is relative to the Netbeans project (e.g., "examples/ShortestPath/test"); If it is an AWS execution, the path is relative to an S3 bucket. The job directory is expected to have the input file; it will have the output file when the job is complete. It also is used to contain intermediate directories in and out.
        vertexFactory - an instance of the vertex class being used
        masterGraphMaker - a master graph maker
        workerGraphMaker - a worker graph maker
        masterOutputMaker - a master output maker
        workerOutputMaker - a worker output maker

      • Job

        protected Job(Job job,
   int numParts)
        Parameters:
        job -
        numParts - the number of parts for this Job. This is a Job attribute so that we can conveniently modify it per Job, to find a good value that appears to be primarily a function of graph structure and size, and possibly problem type (e.g., shortest path)
